com.example.unlibrary.models

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.unlibrary.models.Request

  • public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a borrow request in our application domain.

      • setBook

        public void setBook(java.lang.String book)
        Sets the unique ID of the book to be borrowed.
        Parameters:
        book - unique identifier of a book

      • getState

        public Request.State getState()
        Gets the state of a request.

        REQUESTED - Borrower initiates a request to borrow a book, may be accepted/archived by the owner ACCEPTED - Owner has accepted to lend the book to a borrower, other borrowers are moved to archived BORROWED - Owner has handed off the book to the borrower ARCHIVED - Request has completed either by returning the book to the owner or request was archived

        Returns:
        one of the above state

      • setState

        public void setState(Request.State state)
        Updates the state of the request.

        REQUESTED - Borrower initiates a request to borrow a book, may be accepted/archived by the owner ACCEPTED - Owner has accepted to lend the book to a borrower, other borrowers are moved to archived BORROWED - Owner has handed off the book to the borrower ARCHIVED - Request has completed either by returning the book to the owner or request was archived

        Parameters:
        state - one of the states above

      • getLocation

        public com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint getLocation()
        Gets the handoff location described in latitude-longitude pair.
        Returns:
        latitude-longitude pair of handoff location.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint location)
        Sets the handoff location described in latitude-longitude pair. Latitude-longitude should be retrieved from google maps API.
        Parameters:
        location - described in latitude-longitude
